column4: hello...fun little things, I'm trying to install a script (for random wallpapers)...However I have the small issue that I dont know how to run scripts from the command line
just enter the path to the sscript - /home/user/script?
yes the script must have executable permissions though
yea, I did that part with chmod
what output did you get when running the script
give me a sec to pastbin this
bah, just ment lines8 and 9 but oh well
do you have the libgnome-perl package installed?
its not able to find that package in the repos...
libgnome2-gconf-perl is installing...well is now installed
Yep - thanks...to to figure how you were able to glean what lib's needed to be installed
script used perl(from the output) problem was with gnome(Can't locate Gnome2/GConf.pm) so a quick apt search found it. glad to help.
